tasks.title: Create MCP tool structure for store onboarding
tasks.description: Set up the base MCP tool files in packages/mcp-server for the store onboarding workflow including tool registration and shared types
tasks.details: Create src/tools/store-onboarding.ts with tool registration. Define shared types for workflow state (StoreOnboardingState), URL analysis results (UrlAnalysisResult), and pattern generation (GeneratedPattern). Export tools from main index.
tasks.testStrategy: MCP server builds and tools are registered correctly

tasks.title: Implement store validation and existence check
tasks.description: Build function to validate store ID/name/domain and check if store already exists in registry
tasks.details: Import STORE_ID_CONFIG and STORE_NAME_CONFIG from @rr/store-registry. Validate store ID is numeric string. Validate domain format (no protocol, valid TLD). Check existence by both ID and domain. Return existing store config if found with option to update.
tasks.testStrategy: Unit tests for validation logic and existence checks against real registry data

tasks.title: Build URL collection and normalization
tasks.description: Create function to accept, validate, normalize, and deduplicate URLs from user input
tasks.details: Parse URLs from text input (handle various formats). Use normalize-url for consistent formatting. Validate URL count (5-50). Extract domain and validate against store domain. Deduplicate by normalized URL. Return structured list with original and normalized URLs.
tasks.testStrategy: Unit tests with various URL formats, edge cases, and domain validation

tasks.title: Implement non-product URL filtering
tasks.description: Build classifier to identify and filter out non-product URLs (category, cart, checkout, etc.)
tasks.details: Create URL classifier with patterns for: category pages (/category/, /collections/, /c/), cart (/cart, /basket, /bag), checkout (/checkout, /payment), account (/account, /login, /signin, /register), search (/search, ?q=, ?query=), homepage (path = /). Return filtered URLs with classification reasons.
tasks.testStrategy: Unit tests with real-world examples of each URL type from multiple stores

tasks.title: Build URL pattern analysis engine
tasks.description: Create analyzer that identifies product ID patterns in URLs by examining path segments and query parameters
tasks.details: Analyze pathname segments for ID-like patterns (numeric, alphanumeric, prefixed like prd-, sku-). Analyze query params for common ID params (productId, skuId, item, id). Score patterns by consistency across URLs. Identify format (length, character types, prefix). Group URLs by detected pattern. Flag unmatched URLs.
tasks.testStrategy: Unit tests with URLs from existing fixtures to validate pattern detection accuracy

tasks.title: Implement ts-regex-builder pattern generation
tasks.description: Generate store-registry config code using ts-regex-builder from analyzed patterns
tasks.details: Convert detected patterns to ts-regex-builder syntax. Use buildRegExp, capture, repeat, digit, word, choiceOf, wordBoundary. Generate pathname patterns and search patterns separately. Add comments explaining each pattern. Use lowercase for all literal strings. Format code to match existing config.ts style.
tasks.testStrategy: Generated patterns compile and match expected IDs from input URLs

tasks.title: Build config.ts insertion logic
tasks.description: Implement logic to insert generated store config into packages/store-registry/src/config.ts at correct location
tasks.details: Parse existing config.ts to find insertion point (maintain order by store ID or alphabetically). Generate complete store config object. Handle aliases if detected. Insert with proper formatting and imports. Preserve existing configs unchanged.
tasks.testStrategy: Generated config.ts passes typecheck and lint

tasks.title: Implement fixture JSON generation
tasks.description: Generate product-id-extractor fixture JSON from validated URLs and extracted IDs
tasks.details: Create JSON structure matching existing fixtures: {name, id, domain, testCases}. Each testCase has url and expectedSkus array. Lowercase all expected SKUs. Include all detected IDs per URL. Write to packages/product-id-extractor/src/__fixtures__/{store}.json.
tasks.testStrategy: Generated fixture matches schema and passes JSON validation

tasks.title: Build extraction test runner
tasks.description: Implement function to run product-id-extractor tests and report results
tasks.details: Execute pnpm --filter @rr/product-id-extractor test for the specific fixture. Parse test output for pass/fail status. On failure, extract which URLs failed and show expected vs actual. Return structured result with overall status and per-URL details.
tasks.testStrategy: Test runner correctly reports pass/fail for known good and bad fixtures

tasks.title: Implement git workflow automation
tasks.description: Create functions for branch creation, commit, push, and PR opening
tasks.details: Create branch: feat/store-{storename}-config (lowercase, hyphenated). Stage files: config.ts, fixture JSON. Run full regression tests first - block if any existing stores fail. Commit with conventional message. Push to origin. Use gh CLI to open PR with structured body including regression test results. Return PR URL.
tasks.testStrategy: Dry-run mode that shows what would be executed without making changes

tasks.title: Build update mode for existing stores
tasks.description: Implement workflow branch for updating existing stores with new patterns
tasks.details: Load existing store config and fixture. Analyze new URLs against existing patterns. Identify truly new patterns not covered. Merge new patterns with existing (don't duplicate). Append new test cases to existing fixture. Use update commit message prefix.
tasks.testStrategy: Update mode preserves existing patterns and adds only novel ones

tasks.title: Add comprehensive error handling and recovery
tasks.description: Implement robust error handling, validation messages, and workflow recovery
tasks.details: Clear error messages for each validation failure. Ability to retry failed steps. Clean abort that removes partial state. Git conflict detection with resolution guidance. Timeout handling for test execution.
tasks.testStrategy: Error scenarios handled gracefully with actionable guidance

tasks.title: Create MCP tool integration tests
tasks.description: Build end-to-end tests that validate the complete onboarding workflow
tasks.details: Test full workflow with mock URLs. Verify generated config compiles. Verify fixture passes tests. Test update mode with existing store. Test error handling paths.
tasks.testStrategy: Integration tests cover happy path and key error scenarios

tasks.title: Implement full regression test runner
tasks.description: Run all existing store fixture tests before committing to prevent regressions in ID extraction
tasks.details: Execute full pnpm --filter @rr/product-id-extractor test suite. Parse results to identify which stores passed/failed. Compare against baseline (tests that passed before changes). Distinguish new store failures from regression failures. Block commit only if regressions detected. Provide clear summary: X existing stores passed, Y new store tests, Z regressions.
tasks.testStrategy: Verify runner correctly identifies regressions when intentionally breaking an existing pattern

tasks.title: Update store_check_exists to detect existing fixtures
tasks.description: Enhance the store_check_exists MCP tool to also check for existing fixture files in product-id-extractor, not just store configs in store-registry
tasks.details: Add fixtureExists check using StoreOnboardingManager.fixtureExists(domain). Return additional fields: fixtureExists (boolean), fixturePath (string if exists). Update response messaging to indicate when fixture exists even without store config. This enables the workflow to know if generic rules might already work.
tasks.testStrategy: Unit test that store_check_exists returns fixtureExists=true for domains with fixtures but no config

tasks.title: Add early generic rules test in onboarding workflow
tasks.description: Before generating store-specific config, run tests to check if generic extraction rules already work for the provided URLs
tasks.details: After filtering URLs, if fixture exists or can be created with test cases, run product-id-extractor tests WITHOUT creating a store config first. If generic rules extract the expected IDs correctly, inform user that no store config is needed. Only proceed to pattern analysis and config generation if generic rules fail. This prevents unnecessary store configs.
tasks.testStrategy: Test workflow with URLs that work with generic rules (like Bloomingdale's ID= param) - should not generate store config

tasks.title: Update workflow messaging and decision logic
tasks.description: Update MCP tool responses to clearly communicate the fixture-first workflow and when store configs are/aren't needed
tasks.details: Update store_check_exists response to show fixture status. Add new response states: 'Fixture exists, testing generic rules...', 'Generic rules work! No store config needed.', 'Generic rules failed, generating store config...'. Update store_generate_patterns to skip if not needed. Ensure clear user guidance throughout.
tasks.testStrategy: Manual testing of full workflow with stores that do/don't need configs

tasks.title: Update README documentation for fixture-first workflow
tasks.description: Update packages/mcp-server/README.md to document the improved fixture-first workflow
tasks.details: Update 'What Happens Behind the Scenes' section to reflect new workflow: 1. Check if fixture exists, 2. If exists, test generic rules first, 3. Only generate config if needed. Add new example prompt for 'Test if generic rules work for this store'. Update tips section to mention that not all stores need custom configs.
tasks.testStrategy: README accurately reflects actual tool behavior
